3.label: LED Indication
3.description: LED status when device on or off.

options.label: LED ON when load is OFF
LED On when light is turned On

6.label: Dim Up/Down Rate
6.description: Adjust the speed at which the ramps to a specific value other than 0 and FF

16.label: Switch Mode
16.description: Turn your dimmer into an On/Off Switch

19.label: Alternate Exclusion
19.description: Enables alternate exclusion method to avoid accidental exclusion of device

options.label: Normal Operation, press any button to exclude device
Press two times ON button and two times OFF button, LED will flash 5 times if device is successfully excluded

20.label: Minimum Dim Threshold
20.description: Set the minimum dimmer threshold when manually or remotely controlled

32.label: Default Brightness Level
32.description: Set the default brightness level that the dimmer will turn on when being controlled manually

metadata.inclusion:
1. Follow the instructions for your Z-Wave certified controller to add a device to the Z-Wave network.
2. Once the controller is ready to add your device, press up and release the top or bottom of the rocker.
3. The controllerâ€™s app will indicate if it has discovered the switch. If prompted by the controller to enter the S2 security code, refer to the QR code/security number on the side of the box or the QR code label on the product (see Figure 1). Enter the 5-digit code
metadata.exclusion:
1. Follow the instructions for your Z-Wave certified controller to remove a device from the Z-Wave network.
2. Once the controller is ready to remove your device, press up and release the toggle
metadata.reset: Quickly press ON (up) button three times then immediately press the OFF (down) button three times
